lead_paragraph: Syria’s president offered no hint of compromise in a national speech, dimming hope for peace talks and rejecting the West’s efforts to provide aid.

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: Resisting Peace, Assad Pledges to Retake ‘Every Inch’ of Syria
headline.main: Defiant Bashar al-Assad Vows to Retake ‘Every Inch’ of Syria

snippet: Syria’s president offered no hint of compromise in a national speech, dimming hope for peace talks and rejecting the West’s efforts to provide aid.
abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad vows to retake 'every inch' of country from his enemies in speech that appears to reject West's efforts to provide relief and mediate end to civil war; defiant comments, which seem to reflect Assad's sense of empowerment following Russian intervention in Syria, lower hopes for peace talks.
